conclusion: A is positioned in the lower right corner, moving towards the left.
The first block in A's path is the red block on the right side of the image.
A will likely collide with the red block first and might push it slightly or be deflected by it.
After colliding with the red block, A might change direction slightly upwards or continue left depending on the force of the collision.
If A continues left, it might hit the green blocks next. If deflected upwards, it could head towards the blue blocks.
A will likely stop after colliding with one or more blocks, depending on the force and friction, and might end up near the red blocks or slightly beyond them.
A will collide with the red block first and may continue to collide with the green or blue blocks depending on deflection, eventually stopping near the red blocks or slightly past them.
